newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Israel worries over French writer visit to Morocco.
newsitem.headline: Israel worries over French writer visit to Morocco.

text.p: Israel on Thursday raised alarm over a visit by controversial Moslem French writer Roger Garaudy to Morocco, saying it would stir anti-semitism feelings.

"We are considering with concern the support of the Moroccan academic institutions to Mr Garaudi's intentions to propagate anti-semitism," said the Rabat-based Israeli liaison office in a statement sent to Reuters.
Roger Garaudy, a leading communist ideologue turned controversial Moslem intellectual, caused uproaor over a recent book about Israel's history.

"This attitude, which hurts the feelings of Jews worldwide, is an unprecedented move in the history of inter-communal relations between (Moslem and Jews) in Morocco," the Israeli liaison office added.
There is up to 10,000 Jews living in Morocco.
Garaudy, a member of the Moroccan Academy, has often visited Morocco where he lectured university students and academics as an honourary scholar on Islamic issues.
The official Moroccan news agency MAP said on Thursday Garaudy would hold a conference in Rabat on Monday about his book titled "the Founder Myths of Israel".
Morocco and Israel established low-level diplomatic relations through liaison offices in both countries in 1994.
